intro: Psychotria oreodoxa, commonly known as the "Soul of the Forest," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, clustered white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Psychotria oreodoxa is also notable for its role in traditional medicine and its association with various cultural and spiritual practices.
